definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
the passage of the years/the flow of time

sentences.english: The old worker would not cast off the ragged coat that reminded him of the old days.
sentences.chinese: 老工人不愿丢掉那件使他回忆起过去岁月的破褂子。

sentences.english: Just because of that years of changes with each new, vitality abundant, a riot of color .
sentences.chinese: 只因为那日新月异，生机盎然，色彩缤纷的岁月。

sentences.english: Time passes, we have grown up to your Liangbin already Banbai.
sentences.chinese: 岁月流逝，我们都已长大可您的两鬓却已斑白。

sentences.english: Teachers often try to rub into the pupils that time and tide wait for no man.
sentences.chinese: 老师们经常向学生灌输“岁月不待人”的思想。

sentences.english: Love, is the youth frenzy years round of apricot yellow months, fine but hazy.
sentences.chinese: 爱情，是青春迷乱岁月里的一轮杏黄月，美好而朦胧。

sentences.english: Time passes like flowing water, years if shuttle.
As time moved on, he looked much older than before.
sentences.chinese: 随着岁月的流逝，他显得苍老多了。

sentences.english: Some years I chaos, in short, is displaced, around rock.
sentences.chinese: 我的岁月有些乱，总之，就是颠沛流离，四处晃荡。

sentences.english: The mother and daughter shared their life together, supporting each other through years of hardship.
sentences.chinese: 母女俩相依为命度过了苦难的岁月。

sentences.english: If thou regret'st thy youth, why live?
sentences.chinese: 假如青春岁月令你后悔，何必苟活下去？

sentences.english: The past years had known him in many weathers.
sentences.chinese: 过去的岁月里，他起起落落。

sentences.english: My heart has grown rich with the passing of years.
sentences.chinese: 随着岁月流逝，我的心变得丰富。

sentences.english: I should not have to live my eternity away from my little spider .
sentences.chinese: 我不会离开我的小蜘蛛而孤凄地度过那无边岁月的。

sentences.english: And justs sits there for ages untill i close it and try it again.
sentences.chinese: 只能无奈地坐在那蹉跎岁月，关了又开一试再试。

sentences.english: Like the long river of years at the shore you soft.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢在岁月的长河里凝望彼岸你柔和的倩影。

definition: (literary) to slip/(of looks etc) to fade away/(of time) to slip away/to squander (time, opportunities)/to dillydally
great changes/ups and downs/vicissitudes/abbr. of 滄海桑田|沧海桑田[cang1 hai3 sang1 tian2]
lit. one's youth will never return/to make the most of one's opportunities (idiom)
the passage of the years/the flow of time
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
